testCases.explanation: Collect all non-zero digits from 1..3: [1,2,3]. Concatenated: 123. Sum: 1+2+3=6. Product: 123*6=738. Version II sums across all integers 1..n.
Only integer 1. Non-zero digits: [1]. Concat=1, sum=1. Product=1*1=1.
Integers 1..2. Non-zero digits: [1,2]. Concat=12, sum=3. Product=12*3=36. Or version II may differ.
Integers 1..10. Non-zero digits from 10: [1]. All digits [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,1]. Concat=1234567891. Sum=46. Product large.
Integers 1..5. Non-zero digits: [1,2,3,4,5]. Concat=12345. Sum=15. Product=12345*15=185175.

description: Given an integer `n`, for each integer from 1 to `n`, collect all non-zero digits, concatenate them into one number, compute their digit sum, and return the product of the concatenated number and the sum. Version II processes all integers 1..n together.
